<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 15"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Unified Theory](/Feats.aspx?ID=859) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 268 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Legendary in [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2)

</column>

---

You've started to make a meaningful connection about the common underpinnings of the four traditions of magic and magical essences, allowing you to understand them all through an arcane lens. Whenever you use a skill action or a skill feat that requires a [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10), [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11), or [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) check, depending on the magic tradition, you can use [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) instead. If you would normally take a penalty or have a higher DC for using Arcana on other magic (such as when using [Identify Magic](/Actions.aspx?ID=24)), you no longer do so.
name: Unified Theory
